title: Offer Scope Output
description: Structured output from the offer-scope skill. Contains a complete 1-day build spec with value equation, positioning, distribution plan, revenue model, and kill criteria -- all grounded in persona data and SPEND signals.

offer_id.description: Unique identifier for this offer scope, e.g. 'offer-devops-runbooks-2025-01-15'

domain.description: The domain this offer targets (e.g. 'DevOps education', 'cybersecurity careers')

opportunity.description: The specific opportunity from the signal scan this offer addresses

product_name.description: The name of the product being scoped

format.description: Product format, selected based on ship time, persona consumption context, and price ceiling

price_point.description: Target price, grounded in SPEND data. e.g. '$29', '$19-29'

ship_time.description: Realistic time to build and ship. e.g. '1 day', '6 hours'

trigger.description: The selected decision trigger from persona data

justification.description: Why this trigger was selected -- pain intensity, urgency, and willingness-to-pay reasoning

situation.description: The persona's situation from the pain story

evidence.description: Real evidence: quote, data point, or observation

dream_outcome.description: What the buyer REALLY wants, in their language (not marketer-speak)

perceived_likelihood.description: Why they will believe this works -- connected to operator's real credentials

time_delay.description: How fast they see results -- what changes immediately upon purchase

effort_sacrifice.description: How the product minimizes buyer effort -- what it does FOR them

deliverable.description: What ships -- e.g. 'A 25-page PDF with decision trees and checklists for...'

transformation.description: The single before/after transformation this product delivers

estimated_time.description: How long to create this section, e.g. '2 hours', '1.5 hours'

content_type.description: The type of content in this section

total_estimated_hours.description: Total build time in hours. Must not exceed 8.

headline.description: Uses PAIN language from persona -- makes them think 'this person is reading my mind'

subheadline.description: States the transformation: what they get, what changes, how fast

bullet_points.description: Benefit statements following Feature -> Benefit -> Feeling formula

counter.description: The counter -- acknowledges then addresses with evidence

objection_handlers.description: Mapped directly from persona objections list

social_proof_angle.description: What credibility to lead with, matched to persona's authority bias

guarantee.description: Risk reversal appropriate to the price point

launch_channel.description: Specific community/platform for initial launch -- e.g. 'r/devops value-first thread'

launch_strategy.description: Step-by-step launch plan following the value-first approach

ongoing_channels.description: 2-3 specific channels for ongoing distribution with expected cadence

email_capture.description: Whether to collect emails -- true if repeat purchase potential or upsell path exists

unit_price.description: Unit price in dollars, derived from value equation + SPEND data + format ceiling (use the lowest)

units.description: Target units sold in the first week

revenue.description: Target revenue in the first week (units * price)

units.description: Target units sold in the first month

revenue.description: Target revenue in the first month (units * price)

assumptions.description: Every assumption stated explicitly: conversion rate, traffic estimate, community size, etc.

kill_criteria.description: Conditions under which to abandon the product -- defined before building to prevent sunk cost fallacy

persona_ref.description: Reference to the persona-extract output file used as input

decision_ref.description: Reference to the decision-log output file used as input

signal_scan_ref.description: Reference to the signal-scan output file used as input
